references.paper_title: Ab initio solution of the many-electron Schrödinger equation with deep neural networks
references.reason: This paper established the benchmark for accuracy of neural network wave functions using Slater determinants and is directly extended upon in this work.

references.paper_title: Deep-neural-network solution of the electronic Schrödinger equation
references.reason: This work pioneered the use of neural networks to directly approximate many-electron wavefunctions, establishing the accuracy possible using this approach.

references.paper_title: Sampling-free inference for ab-initio potential energy surface networks
references.reason: This paper introduced the concept of generalized wave functions, which this work builds upon to create a more generalizable model.

references.paper_title: Solving the electronic Schrödinger equation for multiple nuclear geometries with weight-sharing deep neural networks
references.reason: This work demonstrated that the cost of training neural wavefunctions can be amortized by training on multiple molecular structures, addressing a key challenge this work improves upon.

references.paper_title: Modern Quantum Chemistry: Introduction to Advanced Electronic Structure Theory
references.reason: This textbook provides the foundational theoretical background for quantum chemistry calculations, which are directly relevant to the methods employed and evaluated in this work.
